div.p: Probstuecke Digital is a digital edition. All musical and textual parts are encoded in XML. This encoding follows the standards of the Music Encoding Initiative (MEI) and of the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) and builds the core of the edition, which then can be visualised with appropriate software. Due to its nature of a digital edition, these edition guidelines are partially encoding guidelines as well.
All the original clefs are encoded.
Accidentals are adapted to modern practice.
Original double bar lines at the end of a piece are adapted to the modern practice.
Obvious and clear mistakes are corrected.

All textes are provided as a diplomatic transcription, preserving original linebreaks, orthography, mistakes and other idiosyncrasies. Text portions of this edition follow the guidelines of the
DTA ›Base Format‹ (DTABf).
For the sake of easier readability all slashes (/) are replaced by commata (,).

All line breaks and page breaks are preserved (this is not yet encoded in all documents).
Following the TEI Guidelines, <lb> elements encode the beginning of a line. Here, Probstuecke Digital deviates from the DTABf specification.
Musical meters and thorough-bass figures in the text are encoded using a /.
